newsitem.title: USA: United TransNet sees Q3 profit below views.
newsitem.headline: United TransNet sees Q3 profit below views.

text.p: United TransNet Inc said Wednesday it expects earnings for the third quarter ending September 28 will be below analysts' expectations.
First Call estimates predict per-share net income of $0.15 per share. The company became publicly traded in December 1995, and no year-ago information was applicable.
The company said results for the quarter are expected to include losses from its South Central region where United TransNet is restructuring its operations and reducing personnel and facilities.
The company said operational problems identified in the second quarter have been met with "a number of corrective measures," most notably a change in the management in the South Central region.

"These measures have begun to produce the intended results, but progress has been slower than anticipated," said Philip Belyew, president and chief executive officer, in a statement accompanying the announcement.
"We are working aggressively to reduce costs and we expect to see positive results by the end of this calendar year," he said.
Seperately, the company also announced it reached a definitive agreement to merge with Corporate Express Inc, which it expects to complete before the end of calendar 1996.
